alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 7:01PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Whiteside, northeastern Rock Island, northwestern Henry, eastern Scott and southeastern Clinton Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 701 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Calamus to near Blue Grass. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Moline, Rock Island, Bettendorf, Clinton, East Moline, Silvis, Geneseo, Eldridge, DeWitt, Colona, Camanche, Le Claire, Hampton, Port Byron, Erie, Garden Plain, Rapids City, Albany, and Princeton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 290 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 9, and between mile markers 13 and 19. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 3, and between mile markers 10 and 11. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 21. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
